Description:
Job Summary:Responsibilities:Install, configure, and maintain Microsoft Windows Server operating systems and related software.
Manage and monitor Active Directory services, including user and group management, permissions, and security policies.
Administer Microsoft Exchange Server/ Microsoft Office 365, including user accounts, email routing, and mailbox management.
Perform routine system maintenance tasks such as updates, patches, and system backups.
Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network issues related to Microsoft systems.
Implement and maintain security measures, including firewall configurations, antivirus software, and intrusion detection systems.
Collaborate with other IT teams to design and implement solutions integrating with Microsoft-based systems.
Monitor system performance and proactively address potential bottlenecks or performance issues.
Maintain documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures.
Provide technical support to end-users, assisting with software installation, troubleshooting, and issue resolution.
Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours support and emergencies.
Stay up to date with the latest Microsoft technologies and industry best practices.
Responsible for supporting, maintaining, and administrating the IT infrastructure (Data Center, Servers, Storage, etc.)
Disaster Recovery planning and execution.
Responsible for oversight of all IT Helpdesk functions.Skills
Skills: We seek a skilled and motivated Microsoft System Administrator to join our IT team. The ideal candidate will implement, administer, and maintain our Microsoft-based systems and infrastructure. This role requires a deep understanding of Microsoft technologies, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to ensure our IT environment's stability, security, and efficiency.

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a Microsoft System Administrator or a similar role.
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure is a must.
Strong expertise in Microsoft Windows Server operating systems (2012, 2016, 2019).
Proficiency in Active Directory management, group policies, and user authentication.
Experience with Microsoft Exchange Server administration.
Familiarity with virtualization technologies such as Hyper-V or VMware.
Knowledge of networking protocols, firewall configurations, and security best practices.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Relevant Microsoft certifications (e.g., MCSA, MCSE) are a plus.
Microsoft / Veeam certifications
Excellent Communication skills
Excellent time management skills
Resourcefulness and problem-solving aptitude
Teamwork and collaboration

At least ten years of progressively increasing responsibility and achievement in the Information Technology area, with at least five years of system administration.
Experience designing, deploying, and administering scalable, available, and fault-tolerant systems on Azure Cloud.
Must have in-depth, up-to-date, and hands-on knowledge of Microsoft infrastructure technologies, including Active Directory, Exchange Server / Exchange Online, SQL Server, SharePoint Online, Azure/Office 365, Hyper-V, Veeam, DNS, DHCP, Symantec/Veritas Backup Solutions as well as a concrete understanding of the Cisco IOS and associated Cisco LAN/WAN products and Microsoft Defender.
